description: Formed from (the stem of) Latin īris, Ancient Greek ἶρις (îris)  +‎ -al.

adjectives.description: iridal (comparative more iridal, superlative most iridal)
iridal (comparative more iridal, superlative most iridal)

entries.meaning: (chiefly medicine) Pertaining to the iris of the eye.
examples: The iridal dark-brown of her serious eyes had the enigmatic opacity of an Oriental hypnotist's look (in a magazine's back-page advertisement) and seemed to be placed higher that usual so that between its lower rim and the moist lower lid a cradle crescent of white remained when she stared straight at you.
